|homepage = [http://www.ea.com/ EA.com] }} 'Electronic Arts, Inc.' ('EA') is an
American developer, marketer, publisher and distributor of video games. Founded
and incorporated on May 28, 1982 by Trip Hawkins, the company was a pioneer of
the early home computer games industry and was notable for promoting the
designers and programmers responsible for its games. Electronic Arts is the
world's third-largest gaming company by revenue after Nintendo and Activision
Blizzard.

Currently, EA develops and publishes games under several labels including EA
Sports titles, [[Madden NFL series|Madden NFL]], [[FIFA (series)|FIFA
Football/Soccer]], [[NHL series|NHL]], [[NCAA Football series|NCAA Football]],
[[SSX (series)|SSX]] and [[NBA Jam (series)|NBA Jam]]. Other EA labels produce
established franchises such as [[Battlefield (series)|Battlefield]], [[Need for
Speed (series)|Need for Speed]], [[The Sims (series)|The Sims]], [[Medal of
Honor (series)|Medal of Honor]], [[Command & Conquer (series)|Command &
Conquer]], as well as newer franchises such as [[Dead Space (series)|Dead
Space]], [[Mass Effect]], [[Dragon Age]], [[Army of Two]] and [[Star Wars:
Knights of the Old Republic (series)|Star Wars: Knights of the Old Republic]],
produced in partnership with LucasArts. EA also owns and operates
major gaming studios, Tiburon in Orlando, EA Canada in Burnaby, BioWare in
Edmonton as well as Montreal and DICE in Sweden.
Locations|url=http://aboutus.ea.com/locations.action|publisher=Electronic
Arts}}
